<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXECUTION VERSION
</DIV>








<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>11.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Dissolution </B></FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Events of Dissolution</U>. The Company shall be dissolved and shall commence winding up
its affairs upon the first to occur of the following. The Shareholders shall cooperate in
taking any necessary corporate steps under the Companies Act to attain the purpose of this
Section&nbsp;11:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the expiration of the term of the Company pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.4 (Term; Extension);</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the agreement of the Shareholders to dissolve the Company pursuant to Section&nbsp;11.2
(Dissolution by Agreement);</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the election of the Nondefaulting Shareholder pursuant to Section&nbsp;11.3 (Dissolution Upon
Event of Default);</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the first anniversary of the receipt by either Shareholder of a Deadlock Dissolution Notice
submitted with respect to a failure of the Shareholders to approve and agree upon a Business
Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;10.3 (Dispute Resolution; Deadlock) if either (i)&nbsp;the Responding
Shareholder declines to exercise its right to purchase the Shares of the Initiating
Shareholder or fails to respond to such Deadlock Dissolution Notice, or (ii)&nbsp;both Shareholders
submit Deadlock Dissolution Notices with respect to such failure to agree;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(e)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the election by Toshiba to dissolve the Company pursuant to Section&nbsp;11.4 (Dissolution by
Unilateral Option);</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(f)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the bankruptcy, death, dissolution, expulsion or incapacity of a Shareholder or the
occurrence of any other event which terminates the membership of a Shareholder in the Company
(&#147;<U>Bankruptcy Event</U>&#148;); or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(g)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the election of the Notifying Party to dissolve the Company pursuant to Section&nbsp;11.5
(Dissolution Upon Notice) unless the Notified Party elects to purchase the Shares of the
Notifying Party pursuant to Section&nbsp;11.5 (Dissolution Upon Notice).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Dissolution by Agreement</U>. The Company may be dissolved at any time by the unanimous
written consent of the Shareholders.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Dissolution Upon Event of Default</U>. During the occurrence and continuation of an
Event of Default (other than a Bankruptcy Event) with respect to a Shareholder, the
Nondefaulting Shareholder may elect, by written notice to the Defaulting Shareholder, to
dissolve the Company, in which event the Company shall be dissolved and the Shareholders shall
take all actions necessary to wind up the affairs of the Company in accordance with Section
11.7 (Winding Up). This Section&nbsp;11.3 shall not be construed to limit the rights of the
Nondefaulting Shareholder under Section&nbsp;10.4 (Remedies Upon Event of Default) or to seek
damages from the Defaulting Shareholder or any other Person for the breach of its obligations
under any of the FA Operative Documents.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->27<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXECUTION VERSION
</DIV>




<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Dissolution by Unilateral Option</U>. At any time between April&nbsp;1, 2009 and March&nbsp;31,
2010, SanDisk may, by giving written notice to Toshiba, elect to withdraw from the Company, in
which case Toshiba must, directly or through any of its Affiliates, either (i)&nbsp;purchase from
SanDisk all of SanDisk&#146;s Shares within one (1)&nbsp;year following SanDisk&#146;s notice to withdraw for
a cash payment, by wire transfer of immediately available Japanese Yen, in an amount equal to
the &#091;*&#093; as of the FA Termination Date multiplied by SanDisk&#146;s Percentage as of the Termination
Date (the estimated &#091;*&#093; as of the Termination Date to be agreed by the Shareholders in good
faith and any necessary true up payments promptly after the actual &#091;*&#093; as of the Termination
Date is determined), or (ii)&nbsp;cooperate with SanDisk to dissolve the Company within one (1)
year of the notice of withdrawal and to wind-up its affairs in accordance with Section&nbsp;11.7
(Winding Up) (the date as of which any Shareholder, itself or together with its Affiliates,
holds all Shares of the Company or the date the Company is dissolved in accordance with
applicable Law, the &#147;<U>Termination Date</U>,&#148; but in no event shall the Termination Date
occur later than one (1)&nbsp;year following SanDisk&#146;s notice to withdraw).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Dissolution upon Notice</U>. At any time between April&nbsp;1, 2013 and March&nbsp;31, 2014, any
Shareholder (the &#147;<U>Notifying Party</U>&#148;) may elect, by giving notice to all other
Shareholders (the &#147;<U>Notified Party</U>&#148;), to dissolve the Company, in which event the
Company will be dissolved and, within the one (1)&nbsp;year period following the giving of such
notice, the Shareholders shall mutually agree upon a plan for winding up the affairs of the
Company in accordance with Section&nbsp;11.7 (Winding Up), unless the Notified Party, directly or
through any of its Affiliates, elects in writing within three (3)&nbsp;months of receiving such
notice, to purchase from the Notifying Party all of its Shares for a cash payment, by wire
transfer of immediately available Japanese Yen, in an amount equal to the &#091;*&#093; as of the date
of such transaction multiplied by the Notifying Party&#146;s Percentage as of such date.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.6</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Financing Defaults</U>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.5(c)(i) of the Master Agreement either Party, as the Investing
Party, exercises its election to terminate this Agreement, the Shareholders shall cooperate in
good faith to effect the purchase by Toshiba (or its designated Affiliate) and sale by SanDisk
of all of SanDisk&#146;s Shares, at a price equal to SanDisk&#146;s percentage share of the issued and
outstanding Shares in the Company multiplied by the &#091;*&#093; as of the date such transaction is
closed (with estimated &#091;*&#093; as agreed by the Shareholders in good faith paid on the closing of
such transaction and any true-up payment made by the appropriate Party promptly after
determination of the actual &#091; * &#093; as of the closing of such purchase and sale
transaction).</TD>
</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

Party, exercises its election to terminate this Agreement, the Non-Defaulting Party shall have
the same rights as provided in Section&nbsp;11.6(a) and the Shareholders shall cooperate in good
faith to effect the purchase by the Non-Defaulting Party (or its</TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXECUTION VERSION
</DIV>








<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>designated Affiliate) and sale by the Defaulting Party of all of the Defaulting Party&#146;s Shares.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.7</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Winding Up</U>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Upon the dissolution of the Company, the Shareholders shall proceed as promptly as
practicable to (i)&nbsp;wind-up the affairs of the Company and satisfy the Company&#146;s liabilities,
(ii)&nbsp;dispose of the Company&#146;s assets as quickly as possible consistent with obtaining the full
fair market value of the Company, preferably, to the extent it is commercially practicable to
do so, by selling the Company as a going concern (provided, however, no Shareholder shall be
under any obligation to extend the terms of any FA Operative Document or to offer to enter
into any other agreement with a prospective purchaser of the Company for the purchase or sale
of goods or services or the use of facilities or any other business arrangement), and (iii)
distribute any net proceeds to the Shareholders in accordance with Section&nbsp;11.8 hereof and
applicable Law. In connection with a sale of the Company&#146;s assets under clause (ii), each
Shareholder or any of their respective Affiliates shall have a right of first offer to acquire
the Company&#146;s tangible personal property in the liquidation process and may also acquire such
property through participation at auction except in the event of a dissolution pursuant to
Section&nbsp;11.3 (Dissolution Upon Event of Default), in which event the Defaulting Shareholder
and its Affiliates shall not have such right of first offer to acquire the Company&#146;s tangible
personal property. Each of the Shareholders shall be furnished with a statement setting forth
the assets and liabilities of the Company as of the date of the complete liquidation of the
Company. The Accountants shall review the final accounting and shall render their opinion
with respect thereto.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During the period of winding-up, the Company shall continue to operate and all the provisions
of this Agreement shall remain in effect, except as otherwise expressly provided herein. The
Company shall notify all known creditors and claimants of the dissolution of the Company in
accordance with applicable law.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.8</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Liquidation Proceeds</U>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the case of the dissolution and liquidation of the Company, the Company may make a
distribution in kind. Any cash and all distributions in kind that are to be distributed shall
be distributed to the Shareholders, on a pro rata basis based upon the respective Percentages
of the Shareholders as of the date of such distribution.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Unless otherwise agreed by the Shareholders, and to the extent permitted under any agreements
with third parties, all assets to be distributed upon the dissolution and liquidation of the
Company shall be distributed as follows:</TD>
</TR>

    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="4%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>first, to creditors, including Shareholders who are creditors, to the extent
permitted by law, in satisfaction of liabilities of the Company, other than for
distributions to Shareholders pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.2 (Distributions); and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXECUTION VERSION
</DIV>




<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="4%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>second, to the Shareholders on a pro rata basis based upon the respective
Percentages of the Shareholders as of the date of such distribution.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For purposes of this Section&nbsp;11.8, instruments of transfer and other documents reasonably requested
by the distributee shall be executed by the Company or the other Shareholder, or both.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any distribution made pursuant to this Section&nbsp;11.8 shall be made as soon as practicable
under and in accordance with applicable Japanese law.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>12.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Indemnification and Insurance </B></FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">12.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Indemnification</U>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Subject to Section&nbsp;12.1(c), the Company shall indemnify each Person who was or is a party or
is threatened to be made a party to any threatened, pending or completed action, suit or
proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative or investigative (including an action by
or in the right of a Shareholder or the Company), by reason of the fact that such Person is or
was a Shareholder or is or was or has agreed to become a Director or is or was serving or has
agreed to serve at the request of the Company as a director, officer, employee or agent of the
Company or of another partnership, corporation, joint venture, trust or other enterprise,
arising from any action alleged to have been taken in any such capacity or by reason of any
liability or obligation of the Company, against any and all losses, damages, liabilities,
costs, charges, expenses (including interest, penalties and reasonable attorneys&#146; fees and
expenses), judgments, fines and amounts paid in settlement (collectively, &#147;<U>Losses</U>&#148;)
actually and reasonably incurred by him or on his behalf in connection with such action, suit
or proceeding and any appeal therefrom. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, any
of such Losses shall be deemed to arise out of a Company liability or obligation if it arises
out of or is based upon the conduct of the business of the Company (or any of its
Subsidiaries) or the ownership of the property of the Company (or any of its Subsidiaries).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The indemnification provided under this Section&nbsp;12.1 shall inure to the benefit of the
successors, heirs and personal representatives of any Person entitled to the benefit of such
indemnification. Such indemnification shall be a contract right and shall include the right
to be paid advances of reasonable expenses incurred by any such Person in connection with such
action, suit or proceeding.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The indemnification provided under this Section&nbsp;12.1 shall not inure to the benefit of any
Person in respect of Losses to the extent that such Losses (i)&nbsp;arise out of or are based upon
the gross negligence or willful misconduct of such Person or (ii)&nbsp;constitute a tax, levy or
similar governmental charge not imposed upon the Company (or any of its Subsidiaries) or on
their respective properties. The indemnification provided under this Section&nbsp;12.1 shall also
not be available to any Person in respect of any Losses if a judgment or other final
adjudication adverse to such Person establishes (x)&nbsp;that such Person&#146;s acts were committed in
bad faith or were the result of active and deliberate dishonesty and were material to the
cause of action so adjudicated or (y)&nbsp;that such Person gained in fact a financial profit or
other advantage to which such Person was not legally</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->30<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXECUTION VERSION
</DIV>




<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #textcolor#; background: #bgcolor#">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>entitled. It is understood and agreed that, for the purposes of this Section&nbsp;12.1, Losses
shall be deemed not to arise out of or be based upon the gross negligence or willful
misconduct of a Person solely because it arises out of or is based upon the gross
negligence, willful misconduct, bad faith or active and deliberate dishonesty of a director,
officer or employee of such Person if at the time of such gross negligence, willful
misconduct, bad faith or active and deliberate dishonesty, such director, officer or
employee was also a member of the SanDisk Team or a Director acting in his capacity as such.</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The termination of any action, suit or proceeding by judgment, order, settlement, conviction
or upon a plea of nolo contendere or its equivalent shall not, of itself, create a presumption
that the indemnified Person did not meet the standard set forth in Section&nbsp;12.1(c)
(Indemnification).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">12.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Insurance</U>. The Company may, to the fullest extent permitted by law, purchase and
maintain insurance against any liability that may be asserted against any Person entitled to
indemnity pursuant to Section&nbsp;12.1.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">12.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Indemnification by the Shareholders</U>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Each Shareholder agrees to, and does hereby, indemnify and hold harmless the Company and the
other Shareholder from and against any and all Losses arising out of, or based upon, the gross
negligence or willful misconduct of such Shareholder under this Agreement or such Shareholder
exceeding its authority under this Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The provisions of this Section&nbsp;12.3 shall survive each of the termination of this Agreement,
the dissolution of the Company and the withdrawal of any Shareholder.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">12.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Assertion of Claims</U>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event that a Person (the &#147;<U>Indemnified Party</U>&#148;) desires to assert its right to
indemnification from a Person (an &#147;<U>Indemnifying Party</U>&#148;) required to indemnify such
Indemnified Party under this Section&nbsp;12, the Indemnified Party will give the Indemnifying
Party prompt notice of the claim giving rise thereto (a &#147;<U>Claim</U>&#148;), and the Indemnifying
Party shall undertake the defense thereof (unless the Claim is asserted against or related to
or results from any action or failure to take action by such Indemnifying Party). The failure
to promptly notify the Indemnifying Party hereunder shall not relieve the Indemnifying Party
of its obligations hereunder, except to the extent that the Indemnifying Party is actually
prejudiced by the failure to so notify promptly.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Indemnified Party shall not settle or compromise any Claim without the written consent of
the Indemnifying Party unless the Indemnified Party agrees in writing to forego any and all
claims for indemnification from the Indemnifying Party with respect to such Claim. However,
if the Indemnifying Party, within a reasonable time after notice of any such Claim, fails to
defend such Claim, the Indemnified Party shall have the right to undertake the defense,
compromise or settlement of such Claim on behalf of and for the account and risk of the
Indemnifying Party, subject to the right of the Indemnifying Party</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->31<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXECUTION VERSION
</DIV>




<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>to assume the defense of such Claim at any time prior to settlement, compromise or final
determination thereof.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>13.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>If the Indemnifying Party has undertaken the defense of a Claim and (i)&nbsp;if there is a
reasonable expectation that (x)&nbsp;a Claim may materially and adversely affect the Indemnified
Party other than as a result of money damages or other money payments or (y)&nbsp;the Indemnified
Party or Shareholders may have legal defenses available to it or them that are different from
or additional to the defenses available to the Indemnifying Party, or (ii)&nbsp;if the Indemnifying
Party shall not have employed counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party, the
Indemnified Party shall nevertheless have the right, at the Indemnifying Party&#146;s cost and
expense, to defend such Claim. Miscellaneous</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">13.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Governing Law</U>. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in <U>Appendix&nbsp;A</U>, this
Agreement shall in all respects be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
Japan, without regard to the conflict of laws principles.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">13.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Effectiveness</U>. This Agreement shall be effective as of the date first written above
and shall remain in effect until the Termination Date. Sections&nbsp;7, 11.7, 11.8 and 13 shall
survive the Termination Date.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT 10.3<BR>
FOIA Confidential Treatment Requested<BR>
Execution Version
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>COMMON R&#038;D AND PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED COMMON R&#038;D AND PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT, dated as of July&nbsp;7, 2006,
is made and entered into by and between Toshiba Corporation, a Japanese corporation with a
principal place of business at 1-1, Shibaura 1-chome, Minato-ku, Tokyo 105-8001, Japan (hereinafter
&#147;<U>Toshiba</U>&#148;), and SanDisk Corporation, a Delaware corporation, with a principal place of
business at 601 McCarthy Boulevard, Milpitas, CA 95035, U. S. A. (hereinafter &#147;<U>SanDisk</U>&#148; and
collectively with Toshiba, the &#147;<U>Parties</U>&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">WHEREAS, Toshiba and SanDisk Corporation are parties to that certain Amended and Restated Common
R&#038;D and Participation Agreement, dated as of September&nbsp;10, 2004 (the &#147;<U>Prior Agreement</U>&#148;);
and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">WHEREAS, Toshiba and SanDisk desire to amend and restate the Prior Agreement with the effect of
superceding the Prior Agreement from and after the date of this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">NOW, THEREFORE, the parties agree as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Article&nbsp;1. DEFINITIONS</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1 &#147;Contract Technology&#148; shall mean &#091;<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">*</SUP>&#093;.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2 &#147;AMC&#148; shall mean the Advanced Microelectronics Center, Toshiba&#146;s development engineering
facility located in Yokohama, Japan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3 &#147;SanDisk Personnel&#148; shall mean SanDisk&#146;s engineers from the technology areas of
process/device/design, assigned to participate in the Development Work (as defined in Section&nbsp;2.1)
to be performed at AMC or other Toshiba facilities to be mutually agreed upon by the Parties. A
written list of such SanDisk Personnel shall be mutually agreed to by the Common R&#038;D
Representatives.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4 &#147;Effective Date&#148; shall mean July&nbsp;7, 2006.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5 &#147;Solely Developed Patents&#148; shall mean patents, utility models (excluding design patents)
and any applications therefor which arise out of the inventions made solely by the employees of
either Party during the performance of the Development Work hereunder.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.6 &#147;Jointly Developed Patents&#148; shall mean patents, utility models (excluding design patents)
and any applications therefor which arise out of the inventions jointly made by the employees of
Toshiba and SanDisk during the performance of Development Work hereunder.
</DIV>



<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD>Indicates that certain information
contained herein has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and
Exchange Commission. Confidential treatment has been requested with respect to
the omitted portions.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT
10.3<BR>
FOIA Confidential Treatment Requested<BR>
Execution Version
</DIV>







<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.7 &#147;Agreement&#148; shall mean this Second Amended and Restated Common R&#038;D and Participation
Agreement together with any Exhibits, Schedules, Appendices and Attachments hereto including
<U>Appendix&nbsp;A</U> to the Master Agreement, which is incorporated herein by this reference.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.8 &#147;FP Master Agreement&#148; shall mean that certain Flash Partners Master Agreement, dated as of
September&nbsp;10, 2004, by and among Toshiba, SanDisk and SanDisk (Cayman) Limited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.9 &#147;Flash Alliance Master Agreement&#148; shall mean that certain Flash Alliance Master Agreement,
dated as of the date hereof, by and among Toshiba, SanDisk and SanDisk (Ireland) Limited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.10 &#147;Residuals&#148; shall mean that technical information which may be retained in the memories
of SanDisk Personnel who have had rightful access to Toshiba&#146;s proprietary information and Contract
Technology.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.11
&#147;Common R&#038;D Effective Date&#148; shall mean May&nbsp;9, 2000.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;2. DEVELOPMENT COLLABORATION</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1 SanDisk will send, and Toshiba will receive, such number of SanDisk Personnel as are
mutually agreed upon, at AMC or other Toshiba facilities during the term of this Agreement in order
for SanDisk to participate in the development work of the Contract Technology as set forth in
<U>Exhibit&nbsp;B</U> (the &#147;<U>Development Work</U>&#148;), which may be modified by Toshiba and SanDisk
from time to time and in accordance with the direction of Toshiba, subject to review and discussion
by the Common R&#038;D Representatives (as defined below) at the quarterly meetings; <I>provided </I>that such
modification to the Development Work shall not materially affect SanDisk&#146;s permitted access to the
Contract Technology. For avoidance of doubt, it is agreed by the Parties that SanDisk shall not
have any right to have access to, and SanDisk Personnel shall not have access to, any technical
information or data which are not relevant or necessary to perform the Development Work or any
technical information or data for which access by SanDisk Personnel is prohibited by any binding
contract of Toshiba and any third party, and that no right or license is granted to SanDisk with
respect to said technical information or data. The project managers of SanDisk and Toshiba shall
periodically discuss, determine and monitor the details of the Development Work; <I>provided </I>that in
case of any dispute between the respective project managers, the manager of Toshiba may determine
such details, taking into consideration the reasonable input made by SanDisk, subject to review and
discussion by the Common R&#038;D Representatives at the quarterly meetings. In order to perform the
Development Work, Toshiba shall (at its sole expense) provide the SanDisk Personnel with sufficient
office equipment, including personal computers and telephones.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2 Immediately after the Effective Date, each Party shall designate three (3)&nbsp;appropriate
individuals who will constitute the Common R&#038;D Representatives (the &#147;<U>Common R&#038;D
Representatives</U>&#148;). The Common R&#038;D Representatives will meet regularly (quarterly), to
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT
10.3<BR>
FOIA Confidential Treatment Requested<BR>
Execution Version
</DIV>




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">review, discuss and determine direction of NAND future project plans and SanDisk participation
in the Development Work.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.3 SanDisk shall ensure that its SanDisk Personnel comply with the safety, security and all
other applicable practices, regulations of Toshiba and specific instructions or directions to be
made by Toshiba while such SanDisk Personnel are in Toshiba&#146;s facilities. Except as provided in
the Master Agreement, SanDisk agrees to be responsible for all salaries, benefits, expense
reimbursements and other payments to its SanDisk Personnel and workers insurance for SanDisk
Personnel and shall indemnify and hold Toshiba harmless from any claims against Toshiba arising out
of any injury to any SanDisk Personnel.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.4 Except as provided in the FP Master Agreement or Flash Alliance Master Agreement, as
applicable, SanDisk shall be responsible for the living, traveling and all other out-of-pocket
expenses for its SanDisk Personnel.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.5 The amendment and restatement in Section&nbsp;7 is conditioned upon Toshiba considering in good
faith SanDisk&#146;s requests (i)&nbsp;to provide SanDisk with the opportunity to manage the Common R&#038;D
expenditure base (project selection, team development, etc.), (ii)&nbsp;to have SanDisk actively
participate in the entire Development Work and (iii)&nbsp;to ensure to the maximum extent practicable
the cooperation between SanDisk and Toshiba&#146;s engineering, development and technology teams (e.g.
open communication, joint planning of experiments, timely sharing of wafers (for first hand
analysis by SanDisk) and Toshiba&#146;s results of wafer testing), it being understood that the final
determination regarding such requests is to be made by Toshiba, subject to review and discussion by
the Common R&#038;D Representatives at the quarterly meetings. SanDisk shall take appropriate action to
preserve the confidentiality of (and restrict the distribution within SanDisk of) the information
learned in the course of Development Work or any activities contemplated hereunder.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.6 &#091;<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">*</SUP>&#093;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.7 &#091;*&#093;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;3. OWNERSHIP</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1 All technical information provided by any Party in the course of the development of the
Contract Technology shall remain the exclusive property of said Party; <I>provided </I>that, Toshiba shall
have a non-exclusive, worldwide and royalty-free license to use, reproduce and otherwise dispose of
such technical information for any purpose.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2 All technical information, inventions and intellectual property rights resulting therefrom
(but specifically excluding patents) made or generated by Toshiba and/or SanDisk Personnel in the
course of the Development Work shall be the exclusive property of Toshiba; <I>provided </I>that, SanDisk
shall have the right and license set forth in Section&nbsp;4.
</DIV>



<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT
10.3<BR>
FOIA Confidential Treatment Requested<BR>
Execution Version
</DIV>







<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.3 Any Solely Developed Patent of Toshiba shall be and remain the exclusive property of
Toshiba, subject to the licenses granted to SanDisk in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.1.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.4 Any Solely Developed Patent of SanDisk shall be and remain the exclusive property of
SanDisk, subject to the licenses granted to Toshiba in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.5 Any right, title and interest in, to and under Jointly Developed Patents shall be jointly
owned by Toshiba and SanDisk. Each Party shall be free to use such Jointly Developed Patents for
any purpose and shall have the right to grant non-exclusive licenses to any third party without the
consent of the other Party and shall have no duty to account to the other Party for any revenue
therefrom. Both parties shall promptly agree on which of them shall file and prosecute the first
patent application and which countries&#146; corresponding applications shall be filed and by whom. All
expenses incurred in obtaining and maintaining such patents shall be equally shared by the parties;
<I>provided </I>that if one Party elects not to seek or maintain such patents in any particular country or
not to share equally in the expense thereof, the other Party shall have the right to seek or
maintain such patents in said country at its own expense and shall have full control over the
prosecution and maintenance thereof even though title to any patent issuing thereon shall be joint.
The Party electing not seek or maintain such patents shall give the other Party any necessary
assistance required for the preparation and prosecution of such patents filed or maintained by the
other Party.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.6 It is understood by the parties that either Party may perform development of any products
or process independently of the development of the Contract Technology hereunder. This Agreement
is not intended to limit such independent development involving technology or information of a
similar nature to the Contract Technology.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;4. LICENSE</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1 Toshiba grants to SanDisk a non-exclusive, non-transferable, worldwide and royalty-free
license, without the right to sublicense, under its Solely Developed Patents to develop, have
developed, make, have made, use, sell, modify and otherwise dispose of any semiconductor products.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2 Subject to SanDisk&#146;s confidentiality obligations under Section&nbsp;8 and the provisions of
Sections&nbsp;3, 6, 7 and 10, SanDisk shall be free to use, improve or modify without additional
compensation to Toshiba the Residuals, including the use, improvement or modification of such
Residuals in the development and manufacture of SanDisk&#146;s products; <I>provided </I>that this Section, by
itself, shall not be deemed to grant to SanDisk any rights or licenses under any patents of Toshiba
nor shall this Section operate to waive SanDisk&#146;s confidentiality obligations under Section&nbsp;8. In
no event shall such SanDisk Personnel or SanDisk publish or disseminate said Residuals to any third
party.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3 SanDisk grants to Toshiba a non-exclusive, non-transferable, worldwide and royalty-free
license, without the right to sublicense, under its Solely Developed Patents to
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>



<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT
10.3<BR>
FOIA Confidential Treatment Requested<BR>
Execution Version
</DIV>




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">develop, have developed, make, have made, use, sell, modify and otherwise dispose of any
semiconductor products.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4 Toshiba shall prepare and transfer to the Yokkaichi Facility (as defined in <U>Appendix
A</U>) documentation for NAND process concerning the Contract Technology for production at the
Yokkaichi Facility; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that SanDisk may have access to such documentation at such
facilities but shall have no right to disclose or transfer it to any third party.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;5. COMMON R&#038;D EXPENDITURE</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1 Unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the Parties, no Common R&#038;D for non-NAND Flash
Memory technology shall be performed at the Y3 Facility or Y4 Facility. Provided Toshiba continues
to develop and advance NAND Flash Memory technology for the benefit of both parties pursuant to the
FVC Japan Operative Documents, the FP Operative Documents, the Flash Alliance Operative Documents
and the other Joint Operative Documents, SanDisk hereby agrees to share Toshiba&#146;s Common R&#038;D
expenditures and shall pay to Toshiba its portion of such Common R&#038;D expenditures in accordance
with this Section&nbsp;5.1:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the end of each calendar quarter for the calendar quarters from
April&nbsp;1, 2006 to March&nbsp;31, 2007 based on SanDisk&#146;s Net Sales of NAND Flash Memory Products for the
quarter just ended as follows:
</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;For purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.1, &#147;Net Sales of NAND Flash Memory Products&#148; shall mean
&#091;*&#093;:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>

<DIV align="left">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD>&#091;*&#093;</TD>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#091;<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">*</SUP>&#093;</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Notwithstanding Sections&nbsp;5.1(a), (b)&nbsp;and (c)&nbsp;and subject to Section&nbsp;5.1(f), SanDisk&#146;s
quarterly contribution for Common R&#038;D pursuant to Sections&nbsp;5.1(a), (b), (c)&nbsp;and (d)&nbsp;shall not
exceed the sum of (i) &#091;*&#093; of the total Common R&#038;D annual expenditure of the Semiconductor Company
of Toshiba, as notified to SanDisk by Toshiba at the beginning of each Toshiba fiscal year (&#147;Total
R&#038;D Budget&#148;) for the first &#091;*&#093; of the Total R&#038;D Budget and (ii) &#091;*&#093; of the portion of such Total
R&#038;D Budget in excess of &#091;*&#093;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;In the event that any Common R&#038;D activities have been done &#091;*&#093; pursuant to Section
6.6(a)(i) of the FP Master Agreement or &#091;*&#093; pursuant to Sections&nbsp;6.1 or 6.8(a)(i) of the Flash
Alliance Master Agreement, SanDisk shall bear any and all charges incurred by each of Flash
Partners or Flash Alliance from such Common R&#038;D activities at, &#091;*&#093;, and SanDisk&#146;s total
contribution for Common R&#038;D charges pursuant to (a), (b), (c), (d)&nbsp;and (e)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;5.1
shall be reduced by such SanDisk Y3 &#038;Y4 Common R&#038;D Charges; in the event such SanDisk Y3 &#038; Y4
Common R&#038;D Charges exceed in any given quarter the amount for such quarter set forth in paragraphs
(a), (b), (c), (d)&nbsp;and (e)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;5.1, unless otherwise agreed upon by the Parties, &#091;<B>*</B>&#093; of
SanDisk Y3 &#038; Y4 Common R&#038;D Charges shall be borne directly by SanDisk and no payment by SanDisk to
Toshiba for any such Common R&#038;D expenditures shall be made for that given quarter pursuant to (a),
(b), (c), (d)&nbsp;and (e)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;5.1, <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that to the extent of any such excess
amount that has been incurred from Common R&#038;D activities &#091;*&#093; performed without consent of SanDisk,
&#091;*&#093; of the applicable portion of such amount shall be borne by Toshiba.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;The amount of the Total R&#038;D Budget shall be subject to verification if requested by
SanDisk by disclosing internal Toshiba documents to an independent certified public accountant
appointed by SanDisk which shall verify the stated amount of the Total R&#038;D Budget, by written
certification to SanDisk by the appropriate officer of the Semiconductor Company of Toshiba. Such
verification shall be conducted, at SanDisk&#146;s cost and expense, during normal business hours of
Toshiba and not more frequently than annually.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;Within 45&nbsp;days of the start of each of its fiscal years, Toshiba shall provide SanDisk
with a 1-2&nbsp;day detailed presentation of Toshiba&#146;s process development activity at AMC and other
Toshiba facilities for the previous calendar year and forecasted activity for the new fiscal year
as such activity relates to or affects NAND Flash Memory. Any expenses incurred for such
presentation shall be borne by the Party incurring such expenses.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2 Payments made pursuant to this Agreement shall constitute SanDisk&#146;s sole financial
obligation with respect to any and all Common R&#038;D charges from (or through) any Toshiba source.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3 Payments of the fees provided for in Section&nbsp;5.1 (other than Section&nbsp;5.1(a), 5.1(b) and
5.1(c)), which payments shall be made on or before the dates specified therein) shall be made by
SanDisk within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after receiving the invoice to be issued by Toshiba at the end of
each applicable calendar quarter. For the purpose of Toshiba&#146;s issuance of such invoices, SanDisk
shall submit to Toshiba, within 30&nbsp;days following the end of each quarter after April&nbsp;1, 2006, a
written report stating the quantity and Net Sales of NAND Flash Memory Products sold or otherwise
disposed of by SanDisk during the applicable quarter.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.4 All payments under Section&nbsp;5.1 shall be made in Japanese yen by wire transfer of
immediately available funds to the following account or such other account as may be designated by
Toshiba to SanDisk in writing:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">*</SUP>&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Where the provisions of this Agreement require the conversion of an amount initially computed
in another currency into Japanese Yen, the Japanese Yen amount payable shall be calculated using
the New York foreign exchange mid range rates (Currency per US Dollars) published in <I>The Wall
Street Journal</I>, Western Edition, on the last day such journal is published in the calendar quarter
immediately preceding the date of payment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.5 All payments provided for in Section&nbsp;5.1 shall be made without deduction of taxes;
<I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that in the event any withholding income tax is imposed by U.S. tax authorities
on any amount payable to Toshiba hereunder, SanDisk may withhold such income tax from such amount
to the extent that Toshiba may obtain a tax credit against its Japanese income tax. SanDisk shall
without undue delay obtain and send to Toshiba tax certificates evidencing the tax amount withheld
and paid to U.S. tax authorities.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.6 In the event any compensation payable to Toshiba by SanDisk under this Agreement becomes
overdue other than as a result of any action or inaction on the part of Toshiba, Toshiba shall be
entitled to request SanDisk to pay interest at twelve percent (12%) per annum until such
compensation is paid.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7 Toshiba shall have the right, at its sole cost and expense, to have an independent
certified public accountant conduct during normal business hours and not more frequently than
annually, an audit of the appropriate records of SanDisk to verify the number of units of Toshiba
Foundry NAND Flash Memory Products, FVC Japan NAND Flash Memory Products, Y3 NAND Flash Memory
Products and Y4 NAND Flash Memory Products sold or otherwise disposed of by SanDisk and SanDisk&#146;s
calculation of the fees and Net Sales pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;6. WARRANTY</B>
</DIV>







<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1 Each Party provides to the other Party its technical information on an &#147;as-is&#148; basis only,
and does not make any warranty or representation with respect to such technical information for any
purpose.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2 Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed as:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;a warranty or representation that the manufacture, use, sale or other disposal of
semiconductor products by the other Party using any technical information received under this
Agreement will be free from infringement of patents or any other intellectual property rights of
any third Party;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;conferring the other Party any right to use in advertising, publicity or otherwise any
trademark, trade name or names, or any contraction, abbreviation or simulations thereof of either
Party;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;conferring the other Party, by implication, estoppel or otherwise, any license or other
right, except for the licenses and rights expressly granted hereunder; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;an obligation to furnish any technical information or know-how except as otherwise
specifically provided herein.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;7. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL,
INCIDENTAL OR INDIRECT DAMAGE OF ANY KIND, (INCLUDING LOSS OF PROFIT OR DATA) WHETHER OR NOT
ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH LOSS.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;8. CONFIDENTIALITY</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1 As used in this Agreement, the term &#147;Confidential Information&#148; shall mean any information
disclosed by Toshiba to SanDisk pursuant to this Agreement which is in written, graphic, machine
readable or other tangible form and is marked &#147;Confidential&#148;, &#147;Proprietary&#148; or in some other manner
to indicate its confidential nature. Confidential Information may also include oral information
disclosed by Toshiba to SanDisk pursuant to this Agreement, provided that such information is
designated in a manner to indicate its confidential nature at the time of disclosure and reduced to
a written summary by Toshiba within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after its oral disclosure. For avoidance of
doubt, all information observed by or disclosed to SanDisk Personnel at Toshiba&#146;s facilities shall
be treated as Toshiba Confidential Information.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.2 During the &#091;<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">*</SUP>&#093; years period following receipt of such information, the
receiving Party shall keep any Confidential Information, including the technical information
SanDisk has access to at AMC during the course of the development of the Contract Technology
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">hereunder, in strict confidence, and shall not disclose such Confidential Information to any
third party without prior written consent of the disclosing Party. The receiving Party shall
maintain the Confidential Information with at least the same degree of care that the receiving
Party uses to protect its own strictly confidential information, but no less care than is
reasonable under the circumstances. Further, the receiving Party shall not use the Confidential
Information for any purposes other than for the development of the Contract Technology hereunder,
except as otherwise provided herein.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.3 Neither Party shall disclose the terms and conditions of this Agreement to any third party
other than in compliance with any government regulation, without prior written consent of the other
Party.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.4 The confidentiality obligation set forth in Sections&nbsp;8.2 and 8.3 above shall not apply to
any information which:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;is already known to the receiving Party at the time of disclosure;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;is or becomes publicly through no fault of the receiving Party;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;is rightfully received by the receiving Party from a third party without any
restriction on disclosure;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;is independently developed by the receiving Party;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;is disclosed with the prior written consent of the disclosing Party hereunder;
or
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;is disclosed pursuant to applicable laws, regulations or court order; <I>provided</I>,
that the receiving Party shall give the disclosing Party prompt notice of such request
so that the disclosing Party has an opportunity to defend, limit or protect such
disclosure.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.5 Each Party understands that disclosure or dissemination of the other Party&#146;s Confidential
Information not expressly authorized hereunder would cause irreparable injury to such other Party,
for which monetary damages would not be an adequate remedy and said other Party shall be entitled
to equitable relief in addition to any remedies the other Party may have hereunder or at law. In
the event SanDisk is to enter into any joint development work with any third party other than a
tool vendor, SanDisk warrants that Toshiba Confidential Information provided to SanDisk in
connection with the development of the Contract Technology shall neither be used for such joint
development work nor be disclosed to any third party unless expressly otherwise provided hereunder.
If SanDisk desires to work with a tool vendor and to disclose Toshiba&#146;s Confidential Information
to the tool vendor, SanDisk shall first discuss the matter in advance with Toshiba including why it
considers such disclosure to be necessary or appropriate. Any such disclosure shall remain subject
to Toshiba&#146;s written consent in each instance, which it may withhold or condition in its sole
discretion to protect its interests in its Confidential Information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Article&nbsp;9. TERM AND TERMINATION</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1 This Agreement shall become effective on the Common R&#038;D Effective Date and continue in
full force and effect until the later of the termination of the FVC Japan Master Agreement, the FP
Master Agreement or the Flash Alliance Master Agreement, unless earlier terminated as hereinafter
provided. The term of this Agreement may be extended by mutual agreement of both parties. This
Agreement shall automatically terminate upon termination of the FVC Japan Master Agreement, the FP
Master Agreement or the Flash Alliance Master Agreement, whichever is later.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2 If either Party fails to perform or breaches any of its material obligations under this
Agreement, then, upon sixty (60)&nbsp;days written notice specifying such failure or breach, the
non-defaulting Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement forthwith, unless the failure
or breach specified in the notice has been cured during the sixty (60)&nbsp;day period. Termination of
this Agreement pursuant to this Section&nbsp;9.2 shall not relieve the breaching Party from any
liability arising from any breach of this Agreement and such termination shall be without prejudice
to any other rights and remedies of the non-breaching Party provided at law or in equity, in
addition to the rights and remedies set forth in this Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.3 Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement by giving written notice to
the other Party upon the occurrence of any of the following events:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;the filing by the other Party of a voluntary petition in bankruptcy or insolvency;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;any adjudication that such other Party is bankrupt or insolvent;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;the filing by such other Party of any legal action or document seeking reorganization,
readjustment or arrangement of its business under any law relating to bankruptcy or insolvency;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;the appointment of a receiver for all or substantially all of the property of such other
Party; or
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;the making by such other Party of any assignment of whole or substantial assets for the
benefit of creditors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement shall terminate on the thirtieth (30th) day after such notice of termination is
given.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.4 The provisions of Sections&nbsp;3, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 and <U>Appendix&nbsp;A</U> shall survive any
termination or expiration of this Agreement. The provisions of Section&nbsp;4 shall survive the
expiration of this Agreement; <I>provided </I>that SanDisk has paid to Toshiba the total amount of fees
required to be paid in Section&nbsp;5.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->10<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Article&nbsp;10. GENERAL PROVISIONS</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1 Neither Party is required to disclose any information of which disclosure is prohibited
by laws of the country of such Party.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.2 Neither Party shall export or re-export, directly or indirectly, any technical
information disclosed hereunder or direct product thereof to any destination prohibited or
restricted by the export control regulations of Japan or the United States, including the U.S.
Export Administration Regulations, without the prior authorization from the appropriate
governmental authorities. Neither Party will use technical information supplied by the other Party
hereunder for any purpose to develop or manufacture nuclear, chemical, biological weapons or
missiles (hereafter &#147;weapons of mass destruction&#148;). Each Party agrees that it will not knowingly
sell any products manufactured using the other Party&#146;s technical information to any third party if
it knows that the end-user of the products will use them for the development and/or manufacture of
the weapons of mass destruction.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.3 The rules of construction and documentary conventions set forth in <U>Appendix&nbsp;A</U> to
the Master Agreement shall apply to, and are hereby incorporated in, this Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">&#091;Rest of Page Intentionally Blank&#093;
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->11<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT 10.3<BR>
FOIA Confidential Treatment Requested<BR>
Execution Version
</DIV>





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be executed in duplicate,
as of the date first written above, by their duly authorized officers or representatives.
</DIV>

<TYPE>EX-10.4
